criteria.label: Renewable Energy Policy Readiness
criteria.description: Assesses the strength of a country's policy, regulatory, and institutional framework for supporting renewable energy development and grid integration.
criteria.source_long: Energy Sector Management Assistance Program (ESMAP). 2025. Regulatory Indicators for Sustainable Energy (RISE). Washington, DC: World Bank.

criteria.label: Environmental Performance
criteria.description: A comprehensive measure of a country's environmental health and ecosystem vitality.
criteria.source_long: Block, S., Emerson, J. W., Esty, D. C., de Sherbinin, A., Wendling, Z. A., et al. (2024). 2024 Environmental Performance Index. New Haven, CT: Yale Center for Environmental Law & Policy. https://epi.yale.edu

criteria.label: Renewable Energy Production
criteria.description: Share of electricity production from renewables as a percentage of total electricity production.
criteria.source_short: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data
criteria.source_long: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Share of electricity generated by renewables – Ember” [dataset]. Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data Europe”; Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data”; Energy Institute, “Statistical Review of World Energy” [original data]. Retrieved November 24, 2025 from https://archive.ourworldindata.org/20250909-093708/grapher/share-electricity-renewables.html (archived on September 9, 2025).

criteria.label: Recycling of material, energy, and waste
International Investment Attractiveness
criteria.description: Represents a normalized benefit score based on net inflows of foreign direct investment (FDI) as a percentage of GDP. Higher values indicate greater attractiveness to international investors and stronger integration in global capital markets.

criteria.label: Price Stability
criteria.description: This indicator represents a normalized benefit score derived from annual inflation rates based on the Consumer Price Index (CPI). Higher values indicate greater price stability, meaning lower and more predictable inflation for consumers.
criteria.source_short: International Financial Statistics database, International Monetary Fund ( IMF )
criteria.source_long: International Financial Statistics database, International Monetary Fund ( IMF )

criteria.label: Political stability
criteria.description: Measures perceptions of the likelihood that the government will be destabilized or overthrown by unconstitutional or violent means, including politically-motivated violence and terrorism.
criteria.source_long: Worldwide Governance Indicators, 2024 Update, World Bank (www.govindicators.org), Accessed on 10/30/2024.

criteria.label: Control of Corruption
criteria.description: Measures how effectively a country controls corruption and prevents misuse of public power
criteria.source_long: Worldwide Governance Indicators, 2024 Update, World Bank (www.govindicators.org), Accessed on 10/30/2024.
